text: A powerful tool to combine multiple source code files from a project into a single
text or markdown file. It is optimized for providing context to Large Language
Models (LLMs) by respecting .gitignore, removing comments, and adding summaries.
[cyan]<SOURCE_DIR>[/]       Path to the source directory (default: current directory).
[green]-o, --output[/]       Name of the output file (default: combined_output.txt).
[green]--format <fmt>[/]       Output format: 'text' or 'markdown' (default: text).
[green]--copy[/]              Copy the final output to the clipboard instead of saving to a file.
[green]--no-comments[/]      Remove comments from supported source code files.
[green]--no-empty-lines[/]  Remove empty lines from all files.
[green]-i, --include <glob>[/]  Force include files/dirs (glob patterns allowed, e.g., '**/__init__.py').
[green]--no-gitignore[/]     Do not use .gitignore rules to exclude files.
[green]--summary[/]         Prepend a rich project summary (stats, languages, tree) to the output.
[green]--cost[/]            Estimate API cost based on token count (for models like GPT-4).
[green]-h, --help[/]         Show this help message.
[#] Combine all files in the current directory into a markdown file:
[yellow]combined[/] [cyan]./[/] [green]-o context.md --format markdown[/]
[#] Combine a project, add a summary, remove comments, and copy to clipboard:
[yellow]combined[/] [cyan]~/dev/my-project[/] [green]--summary --no-comments --copy[/]
[#] Combine only Python files and estimate the cost for GPT-4:
[yellow]combined[/] [cyan]./[/] [green]-i '**/*.py' -o py_context.txt --cost[/]
